title: Rajanikanta Bordoloi
text:
Rajanikanta Bordoloi () was a noted writer, journalist and <a href="Tea">tea planter</a> from <a href="Assam">Assam</a>, India.
 Some critics called him the "<a href="Walter%20Scott">Walter Scott</a> of Assam".
He was President of the <a href="Asam%20Sahitya%20Sabha">Asam Sahitya Sabha</a> in 1925 which was held at <a href="Nagaon%20district">Nagaon</a>.
Works.
Novels
He was a regular contributor to many leading magazines in that period such as <a href="Junaki%20%28magazine%29">Junaki</a>, <a href="Banhi%20%28magazine%29">Banhi</a>, Usha, Assam Hitoishi and Awahon. He also edited a monthly magazine called "Pradipika".
